main event: A bright fluorescent, pulsating light was observed in the southwestern part of the sky over Orlando, Florida for over 4 hours.
interesting points: The object remained stationary and could be observed through a telescope.
The object was overhead when last viewed about 2 years before the initial observation.
The object exhibited colors of blue, white, and red.
Approximately four-fifths of the initial observers were astronomers.
The object moved from southeast to northwest, with horizontal and lateral movement observed through the telescope.
witnesses: Civilians, including a kindergarten teacher and an 8th grade student
